section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 10. Chapter 10: Diseases of the Respiratory System > e. Vaping-related disorders

content.full_text: For patients presenting with condition(s) related to vaping, assign code U07.0, Vaping-related disorder, as the principal diagnosis. For lung injury due to vaping, assign only code U07.0. Assign additional codes for other manifestations, such as acute respiratory failure (subcategory J96.0-) or pneumonitis (code J68.0). Associated respiratory signs and symptoms due to vaping, such as cough, shortness of breath, etc., are not coded separately, when a definitive diagnosis has been established. However, it would be appropriate to code separately any gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and abdominal pain. (Evidence: pg no: 58, L22-L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: U07.0 must be assigned as principal diagnosis for vaping-related conditions (Evidence: pg no: 58, L22)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For lung injury due to vaping, assign only code U07.0 (Evidence: pg no: 58, L22)
detailed_rules.explanation: Lung injury specifically due to vaping should be coded with U07.0 only, without additional lung injury codes (Evidence: pg no: 58, L22)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Associated respiratory signs and symptoms are not coded separately when definitive vaping diagnosis is established (Evidence: pg no: 58, L23)
detailed_rules.explanation: Respiratory symptoms like cough and shortness of breath should not be coded separately when they are part of the vaping-related disorder diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 58, L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Gastrointestinal symptoms should be coded separately (Evidence: pg no: 58, L23)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unlike respiratory symptoms, gastrointestinal manifestations like diarrhea and abdominal pain should be coded in addition to U07.0 (Evidence: pg no: 58, L23)
